description: Setting it up was way to much having to choose option after option and then having to download additional files and on top of that I was unable to open any image with it. Too, it doesn't completely uninstall.
cant work wicant work with raw2 from panasonicth raw2 from panasonic
summary: cant work with raw2 from panasonic

description:
Digikam is by far the best Photo Management Tool for GNU/Linux distributions. Given its use of the Qt technology underneath, it gets the benefit of being available on Microsoft and MacOS, apart from GNU/Linux.

Digikam has pretty neat filter, annotation, face recognition, and many many more features. A single review will fall short of it. Install and try it for yourself.

simple the best tool to manage your photo collection on linux. i just hope that they would improve face recognition and get into a more usable state (e.g. select all common images of a person) respectvely having it in a more reliable way.
This program is awesome , This program helps me to organize my all the photo more effectively, Is there any way to include google drive photo

been using for several years to maintain my collection of photos. easy to keep them organised with simple tools i can use to make simple modifications (am not a professional or skilled photographer) suits my needs although i dont use all its power
I love Digikam! Best photo management app for GNU/Linux by far. Thanks to all the KDE developers who make it possible.
Easy yet powerful photo management software

On top of having a professional grade photo editor, a very fast image browser and a very good plug-in/extension platform, it is de facto the best digital photo library manager out there. The best part is the extensive and fast album/photo database maintenance function. Latest versions rarely crash. Very customizable. Extensive metadata features, including face recognition and auto-quality rating. 

This thing can only get better. 6 out of 5 stars!
digiKam is amazing.
copyright infringement?
summary: Stole the logo from Google Photos

description: It has close to every feature you would ever want. Import, proper sorting, ability to edit all meta-data including date and geo-data.
summary: The best photo management product I've every used!

description: You click on launch and nothing happens. Sorry
/snap/digikam/4/usr/bin/digikam: error while loading shared libraries: libQt5Sql.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Is it for graphic driver fault ?
summary: Not launching and even not removing

description: whatever I try. It doesn't work
/snap/digikam/4/usr/bin/digikam: error while loading shared libraries: libQt5Sql.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

When moving off of the Adobe eco-system and looking to adopt a purely open-source workflow, one of the biggest questions remained how to handle raw file conversion. I'd tried a handful of other software at that time, many of them very good including Dark Table, but ultimately I found working with Rawtherapee to be just _that_ much faster and more user-friendly.

Years of working with the software has continued to grow compound benefits as I am always learning new shortcuts and new tools to use. I love the automatic recognition of camera and lens, along with distortion auto-correction. I do wish the automatic chromatic aberration tool was a little more accurate with my gear, but it's not bad. I have very recently fallen in love with Rawtherapee's pair of correction curves and the 'Film-Like' curve especially; which seems prevent any intense reds in my photographs from 'blowing out'.

A big thank you to all of the hardworking people behind this fantastic piece of software. The fruit of your dedication has become an essential piece of my current workflow and I am extremely grateful.
summary: Now an Essential Part of my Workflow

description: Need a manual fix of packages and Map + video player are not working. I installed the same version 6.4 using Appimage and it work perfectly !
summary: Missing features and need a manual fix of packages (for ubuntu)

description: I am using digikam now already for a long time and I am still very satisfied with this tool. It allows me to manage my over twohundret thousand pictures with a very good performance. Still I am using only the Sqlite database. My big thank you to the guys who are spending their free to develop the tool.

I had a few problems launching the program but the synaptic program manager and leaving overnight seemed to sort it out. It came good in the morning.
Now I just have to learn to use it !
Installs OK with apt-get. Recognizes Canon but seems not to be able to use usb.
summary: Can't import photos from Canon EOS 350d

description: Not file menu.  How the hell to I open a file. I could not drop an image on it. Basically you have to do it this apps way, not the way every other app works. At least this actually started; version 6.4 won't even start.
summary: Terrible. I just wanted to open a image file

description: Click "Launch" nothing happens
Right click icon in Show Applications returns the message " Cannot find digicam_digicam desktop"

It gives me error:
/snap/digikam/6/usr/bin/digikam: error while loading shared libraries: libQt5Sql.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
This is a deal breaker.
summary: Love the program, hate that it ain't working

description: It is working perfectly on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. Simple install. I am not a professional photographer but need to store a lot of wildlife pictures. Digikam does a superb job.

The user interface is clumsy, over crowded, fonts are not readable depending your theme serious lack of customization but the worse is it's very often buggy!
on mine it's written with white font and light yellow background no need to say it's unreadable, anyway who will chose this type of theme?

I get back to XnView which I should never have left, It's not open source but it's free to use for personal thing

Excellent face recognition, it has the option to save the metadata on the files for portability and better workflow, very fast also, plenty of features it could be have a better GUI bit it's a top notch application!
summary: Excellent! One if not the best Photo organizer on Linux!

description: V7.0 freezes regularly on Ubuntu 18.04 on a 64-bit PC. Will try again when the next update arrives

A serious photo manager with all the tools you need for huge numbers of pictures and very adaptable. Overview of pictures with Calendar view, Tags, clever searches, Geo Tags is all very powerful.
The in built quick editor is OK. And the Raw developer is OK. But it lets you integrate editors and raw developers of your choice.
summary: Powerful. Lots to learn. But it does a Lot!

description: It's stuck in light-mode on my dark Gnome desktop and it doesn't detect my Eos 7D. Other than that it looks nice but these are show stoppers for me.
summary: Stuck in light mode and can't find my Eos 7D

description:
I were looking for getting away from google photos and the organizational options in digiKam is perfect.

Especially the face-recognition with local storage and the ability to see all my pictures in map-view are great easy-access features for amateurs.
The best photo management ever to be used
As good as it gets, at least from a Linux user's perspective.
why from Discover it shows version 7.0 while is installed 6.4 and from website is available 7.1?

I dont' understand the low ratings given by some. Digikam is not competing with Darktable as a raw image developer, although it can do that to certain degree. However as a management tool it is simply the best.
summary: best linux manafement tool for photographies

description:
"It says unable to perform following tasks:"

it doesn't show any tasks

I use several DSLR cameras and they all connect just fine with digikam, I have a canon 7D, T7, T7i, Nikon DSLR, and a few other small cameras. Works flawlessly with all of them, you may have to setup your cameras in order for them to work, but its so easy to do!! Love the work!
Upgraded to Ubuntu 20.04 and whoosh: gone is the app and being confronted with this version 7.1 which does not recognize the old database in my own folder. Nice going digikam!
Crashes when importing a large folder of images. Cannot get it to launch. Just crashes after a few seconds. Running the latest KDE Neon version from the Discover store.
Supposedly installs, then there is no run command?

User experience only OK:
- Quite fiddly, with a steep learning curve
- poor deployment pipeline - too many ways of installing and none of them result in getting the latest that actually works. On ubuntu can get snap (latest but doesn't work well), ubuntu (very old), flatpak (which hangs back at previous release). Someone at KDE needs to sort out that mess.
- Has some good DAM features, but strangely no support for divorcing organization of photos / albums from the file system (in digikam the file and folder organization IS the organization)... that is not very flexible and results in big problems for backing up large collections.
- very confusing where to turn for support. KDE forums - nobody responds EVER. There's a mailing list, but it gets confusing whether I should post there or via bugs interface (which is exceptionally hard to use).

It appears that digikam was invented by someone with good intentions, but developed by and maintained by Linux nerds. The result is a poor user experience, with confusing support and versioning.
summary: User experience only OK - Quite fiddly, poor support

description: It has many tools and options. Very intuitive.
summary: sometimes it gets slow, but all in all it works fine

description: Works very well, with many handy features
Works extremely well. One feature I would like to have is "collections" - something that cuts across keywords and albums

Really great and free!
Has all the necessary features but also very easy to use
Merci merci! I use this app all the time.
Great way to sort photos, has face recognition! WOW!
summary: Great way to sort photos, has face recognition! WOW!

description: it s prety convinient for me ,easy to find your ways,works fine 4 me

This is easy to understand program. Works fine for all types of images. I have used GIMP and Shotwell. GIMP may have more features like working in layers but this is easier to learn. Used this since 2002 especially because of its great database for images and movies. Picture finding by date, or by color code. Or by size or whatever word has been used to describe the picture. Excellent.

Came highly recommended, but it couldn't see my Moto G6, even though Linux as such did see it, and Shotwell had no problem with it and saw it without even being prompted. Admittedly digikam is reportedly intended for KDE and I had Gnome/Wayland... maybe that had something to do with it. Maybe. If it works for you I'm happy for you... it just didn't for me, and I can only rate what I actually saw. Sorry.
summary: Didn't recognise Moto G6 on Wayland

description: super fast, has all features I can possibily think of... i love it since start using it years ago. On all platforms and DEs my favorit!
summary: works great to manage 1000s of pictures

description: That says something, with the fact that this is the main purpose of the program.
Such an awesome piece of software.

Been using happily for years but can't launch now from desktop or terminal after a latest/stable update to version 7.2.0 (June 2020).
Terminal gives rise to error : /snap/digikam/16/usr/bin/digikam: error while loading shared libraries: libpulsecommon-13.99.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory.
Switched to latest/candidate version version 7.3.0. and this launches fine.(24/7/21)
Crashing again. Today the latest/candidate version 7.3.0 was moved up into stable and that fails at launch with graphics driver errors after splash screen at the point where there's a request to download the extra data files for face recognition and red eye (I don't use either so would prefer not to).
Could not link shader program:
 ""
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
benn using it for a couple of years now and i think it s great
It seems that this might be great if only it could search more than the root drive.
Worked great but doesn't launch now !
summary: Worked great but doesn't launch now !

description:
Title. Works like a charm, but keeps crashing every time i run the face indexing tool.

Also no obvious way to set what is to be considered "reference image" when doing duplicates. It's not consistent what is the "reference". Sometimes it might be the largest (file size) image, sometimes it's not. And I'm not sure if a 140 KB and a 2,5 MB image ought to be considered "identical files" ?
summary: Great, but keeps crashing on Facial Recognition indexing

description: It seems to be a great app with lots of features but I guess I don't have the patience to figure out how to use it. I've never been able to get it to work twice in a row. It's really bothersome because I'd really like to use it.
Purged my ex brother-inlaw from all our photos..

I used this app awhile trying to understand what it does and then I tried to organize all my photos which were scattered across different storage devices and backup sites like dropbox. I got them in one huge directory and am able to do with them as expected. This cleared all the doubles and made my photo project very managable.

Many good features but I have been unable to find how to batch resize photos and not just individually, something I absolutely need; if someone can be bothered to explain how to do this, or add it as a feature if currently not possible I'll review my rating...
KDE DigiKam Is Unique, Important, And Necessary Alongside Apple Photos And Adobe Lightroom. They seem similar yet you need all three. Don't wish for one app with all these features.
summary: Unique Important Necessary Alongside Apple Photos and Adobe Lightroom

description: This app is so unstable and unusable for me that I need to drop it. I like the features but it wreaks havoc on my nerves as it's really buggy and slow on imports an hangs and crashes a lot without any results.
Keeps asking for the database location.

I have been using shotwell for my photos between windows and Ubuntu, but this program blows shotwell away, in Both Windows and Ubuntu this is packed full of features and options. Ias a photographer I have over 50,000 photos to process and this progam is serving me well .
summary: Was using Shotwell until I found this gem

description:
Enjoy the Picasa replacement. Althouth now it's hard to use face recognition but I believe that in the next version it'll be done.
And BTW: This version is better than Flatpack variant.
summary: Also the greatest photo management program with face recognition

description: opened digikam and went through an interminal amount of initial dross to use the program and regretted installing it straight away, I got fed up with trying to use it and removed it instantly
summary: all I want is to catalogue my photos

description: Fantastic photo manager when it works. Version 7.8 worked well, in ubuntu 22.04, for a couple of hours. Created a collection database, including all albums and thumbs. While creating image fingerprints the app suddenly shut down and is not possible to restart.

Went through all the steps to configure, will not recognize camera even thought the camera shows up when I turn it on. Extremely not user friendly. I find that at least half of the free software available that I try simply do not work. Do the developers ever check out their work? I used to develop software and you don't release something until you are sure it will actually work as described.

Currently using Ubuntu 22.04. The previous version worked fine (7.7.0?) but 7.8.0 will not update folder tree or thumbnails - despite rebuilding thumbnails and rescanning and compacting databases. Something's gone wrong and - to be blunt - photo management software that can't show the thumbnails is not photo management at all! Fortunately, Showfoto 7.5.0 will still work alongside and gets around this particular shortcoming to some extent - but Digikam still needs fixing please!
summary: Was good in Windows & Linux but the cataloguing has failed in 7.8.0!

description: This app contains a lot of sales text saying things like "You can use a network share" or "You can import photos from X" but never *how* to do it, and often these features don't work and aren't documented in the manual. Ignores system language/locale settings. Kitchen sink UI full of things that don't work properly.
summary: Tells you you can do things, not how, and doesn't work

description:
It worked OK on Ubuntu 20.04
After upgrading my system to Ubuntu 22.04 LTS Digikam can't upload any picture.. thus it has become useless to me
Only sees directories on the local drive. Useless if you have files on a NAS, additional hard disk, or USB.
Played around for an hour and got no where trying to find duplicates.
It opens but for all intended purposes it's broken.
Unfortunately the provided version 8.0.0-beta is a bit buggy. I had to change to the appimage version to use the recent (stable) version of digiKam. Besides this, I like digiKam.

Ohh my God, where to start... Installation took couple of hours. Bunch of unstable "new versions" out there. Once it is installed, it is crashing in every single thing I tried: tried renaming, crashed. tried accessing NAS, crashed. So, unforetunately, I do not know how good this software is since it only crashed on me.
summary: Waste of time at the moment

description: I dunno if this is Flatpak shenanigans but the only folder I'm allowed to access is ~/Pictures, which is a bit useless.
no words,everything is said

1. Doesn't recognise External/USB drive, if you try to add a "collection" from External/USB

2. Crashes on "Import" from External/USB devices

3. Cannot create a folder on Piwigo.

Digikam is the best photo manager I've seen. Its pretty simple to use but give you some massively useful tools. No matter what way you organize your life if you enjoy organizing it and you like metadata you'll want digikam..
summary: Simply The Best in Photo Management

description: What a horrible piece of software, ugly interface and does not show many of my images even though they are JPG. It was the third time I installed this forgetting how bad it was and immediately uninstalled it. shotwell is so far the best open source photo manager I have used in Linux followed by ART for photo editing.
When I try opening Settings it crashes my whole Gnome session on Ubuntu 20.04. It's a 100% reproducible bug. Incredible.
summary: It is crashing my whole Gnome session

description: The best photo catalog software I can find! It's simple to use and I can sort and search by tags without convoluted menus. I can also store photos by year and month and it preserves that structure.
A professional program for managing photos. Not suited to general users. The flatpak release works well.

This is a great tool but I found I needed to download Flatseal and edit the file permissions to let it see all user files. Only then could I see the photos, as I stored them outside of pictures directory

Das Programm sieht vielversprechend aus, aber meine Fotos befinden sich auf einer externen Festplatte und damit kommt Digicam nicht zurecht. Es böleibt hängen, liest die Bilder nicht ein, friert komplett ein. Daher für mich unbrauchbar.
summary: Kann mit grossen Sammlungen von ext. SSD nicht umgehen

description: Seit dem ich unter Windows Picasa verwendet habe, war ich auf der Suche nach einem ebenbürtigen Programm, das einfach und intuitiv Fotos verwalten kann. Nach meinem Umstieg auf Linux habe ich Digikam getestet und bin dabei geblieben. Mittlerweile ist das Programm sehr gut. Es gibt sicherlich noch einige Verbesserungsmöglichkeiten, zB im Editieren, aber ich verwende sowieso Gimp oder Photoshop um Fotos zu bearbeiten.
Eines meiner must haves. Trotz einiger Schwächen.

Digikam ist ein Must have. Das was leider wirklich nervt sind Akonadi und KIO. Akonadi bringt so einen Rattenschwanz an Abhängigkeiten mit, die man eigentlich gar nicht braucht für Digikam. KIO hingegen bremst mich sehr aus, wenn es um externe mounts geht. Schade!
Super Programm, aber die aktuelle DigiKam Version ist 6.4.0 hier über die Repos wird nur die 5.4.0 angeboten es fehlen Bugfixes und Features. Schade..
...der keine Bilder anzeigt, prima. Das Programm funktioniert einfach nicht.

Es lassen sich nicht nur alle Metadaten der Fotos ändern, sondern auch eine nachträgliche Geolokalisierung einbinden.
Top Programm auf der Höhe der Zeit - Weiter so!
for an upgrade from 6.x not usable in case you are already using mysql
es funktioniert vieles gut aber das wichtigste leider gar nicht und oder nur über KDE "Öffnen im Dateimanager" bspw. Wallpaperexport auch nicht und auch nicht die Sprachauswahl..

Die "normalen" Funktionen sind schnell gefunden und das ausführen läuft auch bei großen Datenmengen richtig schnell.
Leider stürzt das Programm bei einem versehentlichen flaschen taggen in der Personendatenbank ab und zeigt nicht an, wo man den Fehler gemacht hat.
Daher nicht die vollen 5*
Zur Info:
Programm läuft unter Ubuntu 20.04 auf einer Sony/Vaio amd64 Maschine.
summary: Ein sehr gutes und umfangreiches Programm für die Fotoverwaltung

description: Digikam hat alle Funktionen, die ich für die Arbeit mit meinen Bildern brauche. Über einen Mediaserver kann man das Programm auch auf mehreren Rechnern Nutzen.

only 4 stars because it
crashes from time to time
Fotoverwaltung super einfach. Vorallem die Kipiplugins machen Spass. Multiuser mit SQL Anbindung möglich.
Kann keine Dateien direkt aus Netzwerkordnern laden.

Hallo
die Möglichkeiten unter Digikam 8.0.* sind enorm und ich habe nur einen kleinen Teil der Funktionen bisher benötigt. Insbesondere liebe ich die Geo-Lokalisierung und auch die Geo-Filterung. 
Leider erfahre ich unter Windows Instabiltäten und Bild-Datei Korruption. Wenn ich nach Änderungen an Alben, wie Bild Titel, -Beschreibung, -Geo-Lokalisierung Änderungen vornehme und nicht schnell eine manuelle Wartung der Datenbank mache, werden häufiger Bilddateien beschädigt.
Die Liste der Wünsche ist lang, z.B. Import eines gpx-Tracks mit Darstellung des Verlaufs und den Aufnahmeorten. In der manuellen Geo-Lokalisierung ist diese Funktion bereits enthalten, aber es wäre auch z.B. für eine Diaschau sehr wünschenswert um den Kontext eines Bildes im Verlauf einer Reise sichtbar machen zu können.
Trotz der unten beschriebenen Instabilitäten ist Digikam für mich sehr wertvoll. Ich vertraue auf die Bugfixes

Läuft bei mir seit über 10 Jahren. Es war in den ersten Jahren nicht an jeder Stelle immer 100% stabil, aber welche Software diesen Umfangs ist das schon? Die Fülle an Möglichkeiten und Funktionen und die trotzdem gute Übersichtlichkeit sind wirklich beeindruckend. Lieber Gilles Caulier, weiter so!
summary: Für mich die beste OpenSource-Lösung für die Verwaltung von Bildern

description: Das Programm bietet alles ,was man zur Verwaltung seiner Foto-Sammlung benötigt und einiges mehr. Im Vergleich zu Programmen, die von Kamera-Herstellern geboten werden, ist es sowieso unschlagbar. Und als kostenlose Alternative kann es auch mit den kommerziellen Alternativen mithalten.
Nachdem ich das Udate zu Ubuntu 22.04.3 geladen habe findet Digikam die Bild-dateien nicht mehr, ich kann auch keine neuen laden. Wer kann mir helfen?

Version 8.1.0:
Keine Installation durch Abbruch mit Fehler "... fehlende Rechte ... CREATE TABLE ..." möglich, obwohl alle Rechte vorhanden waren und die Datenbankdatei auch auf der DS angelegt wurde.
Ewiges Recherchieren und Testen hat nichts gebracht.
summary: Mit Disc station nicht zum Laufen gebracht

description: Nada que envidiar a los grandes y privativos softwares, cubre todas mis necesidades relativas a la catalogación de fotografías.
Completo, funcional, puedes organizar las fotos, cambiar aspectos de ellas...Lo único ser muy completo le hace ser más pesado que otros más sencillos.
summary: Quizás el más completo de los gratuitos para Linux

description: Interesantes características para organizar y modificar las fotos. No es perfecto pero de lo mas completo para Linux gratuitamente.

Lo uso desde hace años. Ha ido mejorando y me parece el mejor para gestionar la colección de fotos.
Ideal para encontrar fotos cuando tienes muchas. Las localiza por etiquetas. Por valoración de la foto. Por metadatos como la lente, la focal utilizada.
Por ahora, ninguno se le acerca en gestión de colección.
summary: El mejor para gestionar la colección de Fotos

description: Aunque promete mucho, la instale varias veces en mi computadora alienware y nunca funcionó
como uasr si no se instala,

..$ digikam
/snap/digikam/6/usr/bin/digikam: error while loading shared libraries: libQt5Sql.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
lo unico que extraño de windows es picassa,digikam es lo mas parecido que encontre,un poco mas feo esteticamente pero totalmente operativa
funciono muy bien para poder seleccionar fotos repetidas ..
me parece buena
Es estupenda para tener organizadas las fotos.
No consigo que se abra......... No funciona
He probado varios organizadores de fotos y etiquetas. Me quedo con digikam.
Si no se conecta a internet no funciona

Le falta desarrollo a la Interfaz pero su funcionalidad 
es excelente, sirve para cualquier necesidad fotogràfica.

Estupendo para gestionar colecciones de imágenes grandes, buscar imágenes duplicadas o casi iguales, encontrar mediante casi cualquier criterio imaginable (fecha, cámara, ubicación, etiquetas, hasta empieza a disponer de reconocimiento facial, muy malo de momento, es verdad, pero en ello están), pero el diseño parece hecho por alguien venido de los años 90: lleno de espacios vacíos absurdos, líneas y recuadros molestos... Deberían copiar la limpieza de Gwenview, por ejemplo.

También deberían aligerarlo quitándole funcione inútiles, como el revelador raw o el editor Showfoto, que nadie usa porque para eso están aplicaciones mejores como Darktable o GIMP, y dejarlo sólo como gestos de imágenes. Zapatero, a tus zapatos.
summary: Muy bueno pero diseño de interfaz horrible y alguna que otra función p

description: tiene opción en español?
En funcionalidades no le falta nada y aún es más rápido que los demás, tiene funciones que ningún otro tiene para el escritorio Linux.

je l'utilise quasi tous les jours, ma base de données est très fournie l'acquisition et le classement des photos est tres facile à faire, showfoto derriere m'évite d'utiliser lightroom mais il me manque des outils comme dans capture one.

Les photos s'accumulent depuis quelques années déjà et le logiciel ne bronche pas. La gestion des étiquettes et des métadonnées est poussée et permet véritablement d'obtenir une classification personnelle. A noter que Digikam propose un système de reconnaissance faciale mais celui-ci, bien que fonctionnel, demandera très souvant une vérification manuelle car les erreurs restent nombreuses. 
Je n'ai pas vraiment exploré les possibilités de l'éditeur d'image (j'utilise un logiciel dédié pour le développement RAW) mais celui de Digikam semble tout à fait capable de remplir les taches basiques et même plus. 
Le logiciel sur des configurations peu musclées se révèle un peu lourd (étiquettage de nombreuses photos d'un seul coup...), mais il est possible de jouer sur les avec les paramètres pour les limiter cet effet. 
Enfin les mises à jour sont nombreuses et le site officiel propose une documentation très complète qui permet de découvrir le logiciel pas-à-pas.
well made but crashes sometimes

Pour le catalogage de ses photos il est parfait, ont peut lui assigner des tags sont moteur de recherche est rapide, je l'utilise sous Windows et Linux
depuis plusieurs années.

Une foi installer ne souvre pas, pourquoi, si les développeur pouvais faire quelle que chose, pourtant sais un logitiel que j'utilisais depuis des année sur ubuntu déja, et au qu'elle j'aurais mis 5 étoiles.
Une fois installée la version 6.4 beta, impossible de la lancer dans ubuntu 19.10. Pourtant Snap est installé. Pourquoi? La version 6.2 chargé comme appimage fonctionne bien.
summary: 6.4 beta ne s'ouvre pas dans Ubuntu

description: processeur i7 et 16Go RAM, affichage et édition sont d'une lenteur telle que ça rend l'utilisation du programme impraticable concrètement
je l'utilise de depuis 1 ans et je vous le conseil
Super logiciel ! Simple beau et vraiment paramétrable...Hélas, quelques bugs gênants...Passage en N&B impeccable mais au bout de 3 ou 4 photos traitées, ça plante...Depuis longtemps déjà !

IL me permet de faire quasiment tout ce dont j'ai besoin pour mes photos: Transfert depuis l'appareil photo, diaporama, ajouts de tags, d'étoiles, ajout de la géolocalisation, traitement par lots, identification de personnes. J'apprécies les différentes vues possibles: par dossiers, chronologique, par tags, sur une carte,...
Logiciel très complet !
Je l'utilise depuis plusieurs années, il reste toujours aussi fiable.
Logiciel très au point. Trio d'enfer avec Gimp et Darktable!

Un peu austere a la premiere impression, il est ideal un fois la configuration etablie, J'aime les multitude d'options pour la gestion de la db. j'utilise pour le moment seul la gestion des photo, pas d'dition et deja pour cela il est plein de ressources, et il prends en compte les .heic format necessaire pour moi aujourd'hui.

J'utilise Digikam depuis plus de 10 ans, c'est le meilleur logiciel de cette game qui permet de tagger toutes les photos rapidement pour ensuite profiter pleinement de celles ci. Je gère 78000 photos et je les ai toutes taggées très facilement.

Merci aux développeurs .
summary: Tout simplement le Meilleur Logiciel de gestion de photothèque

description:
Permet de trier , organiser une photothèque importante. 
L'application est dotée de nombreuses fonctions qu'il est préférable d'examiner d'abord sur un sous-ensemble de photo.
On apprécie de pouvoir taguer les photos facilement et en masse ce qui permet de constituer des albums beaucoup plus facilement. La fonction Timeline est également très pratique et puissante.
Néanmoins un outil de traitement par lot des metadonnées EXIF aurait été un plus .

Même si elle ne s'intègre pas à merveille avec le bureau GNOME, cela reste la meilleure application open-source que j'ai trouvée pour trier des photos ! Avec reconnaissance de visages et tous les outils de retouche nécessaires.
J'ai utilisé digikam pendant des années sur linux (2013/2021) avec grand plaisir , c'était génial....et puis maintenant ce logiciel ne fonctionnne pas.

Sous Fedora 33 impossible de voir les photos de l'album. De plus certaines modifications dans les parametres font friser Digikam. Pourtant Showphoto fonctionne à merveille pourquoi ???
J'ai adopter Showphoto!!
Je l'utilise depuis des années en complément de Darktable. Très utile pour cataloguer ses photos et faire des retouches de base

Пользовательский интерфейс виснет в неожиданных местах, иногда в дополнение к этому весь экран начинает мигать, а мышиный курсор оставляет многочисленные следы повсюду. После этого приходится программу убивать, и запускать снова, но через скорое время опять виснет и мигает. В целом -- ужас!

Если перед установкой выбрать Источник: altlinux (Пакет), то приложение работает нормально. А если выбрать Источник: Flathub (Flatpak), то приложение вообще не запускается, клацаешь по ярлыку и ноль эмоций. Само приложение просто комбаин, стартует долго даже с ccd, но функций действительно хватает.
summary: Работает если ставить из Источника altlinux

description: digiKam is an open-source program of photo management. It allows you to view, edit and manage photos from your digital cameras, phones and other devices. It has a face-detect function, works with RAW photos and allows to enchance quality of photos. Works nice and flawlessly. I recommend.
Great app, but version from flatpak can not see any folder. I shall install from system repository.
Бессмысленный продукт. 2 раза удалял и 2 раза ставил Не работает.
The app doesn't import any photos into a database. :( All permissions are given.
Работает отлично, много инструментов. По сравнению с ранними версиями, сейчас всё куда серьёзней. Комбайн!
Хорошая программа в смысле возможностей, но интерфейс слишком ужасен, ни о каком единстве оформления с системой даже речи быть не может.
号称是linux史上最强大的P图软件，准备下载试试
summary: 号称是linux史上最强大的P图软件，准备下载试试
